intro: Brotera contrayerba, commonly known as the "false brotea," is a tropical plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical studies.
